a.span: How to Contact Teachers and Staff

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

span.p: Please refer to this section for the latest updates about the Coronavirus (COVID-19) from the district, as well as other useful information and resources. Please note that this website and district messages are the only source of reliable information pertaining to our schools.

span.strong: As mandated by the Governor of New York, all buildings are currently closed until further notice. No one is allowed to enter, except for essential staff.

span.em: Check out the blue navigation menu for related resources and news, including mental health resources, positive stories about our students and Baldwin family, and additional guides and resources in the eLearning section.

hr.p: To ensure you receive notifications from Baldwin Union Free School District, please make sure your contact information is updated with the Main Office of your child's school. We are aware that there has been a delay in delivering some of the district's messages. ParentLink/BlackBoard Connect, the service we use to disseminate information, has been working to resolve this issue. Due to the abundance of messages going out from school districts nationwide, these delays may occur from time to time.

span.p: Please see the following update as of 4/17/2020

p.strong: To reach teachers, principals, and other staff,

hr.p: New York State Office of Mental Health Crisis Counselors: 1.800.273.TALK or text GOT5 to 741741. Also see related resources and contacts.
Department of Health (DOH) Hotline: 1.888.364.3065 (to speak with a Coronavirus expert)
Eduardo Ramirez, Director of Health, Physical Education & Athletics, 516.434.6081
